poem:
**Morning Headlines**

In the glow of ink-stained news,  
a character unfurls,  
each word a stroke of fate,  
etching shadows into daylight.

Once unseen,  
dressed in doubt,  
now composed  
by the gravity of truth,  
an elaborate fiction unravels,  
vanishing like smoke.  
The clean, crisp morning air remains,  
patient witness to the murmurs of the page.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Noel Clarke ‘precisely the man’ depicted in Guardian’s reporting, high court told Noel Clarke has been shown to be “precisely the man” depicted in the Guardian’s articles accusing him of sexual misconduct, vindicating its journalism, the high court has heard. In closing submissions in the former Doctor Who actor’s libel claim against Guardian News and Media (GNM), Gavin Millar KC said Clarke had been forced to come up with an “elaborate conspiracy theory” to try". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
